title: Quick question, skip1 starter
question:
Both valid approaches? My way makes more sense to me, and was the immediate way I thought of solving it. This is a trivial problem but leads me to a larger question. Would there ever be a limitation on the number of accumulators (within reason)?
 
Note: its the Skip1 lecture starter, and I don't know how to format the code for piazza :p
(@htdf skip1)
(@signature (listof X) -> (listof X))
;; consume list of elements, producing only odd (1, 3, 5,..) elements in list

(check-expect (skip1 empty) empty)
(check-expect (skip1 (list 1)) (list 1))
(check-expect (skip1 (list 1 2)) (list 1))
(check-expect (skip1 (list 1 2 3)) (list 1 3))




(@template (listof X) accumulator)

(define (skip1 lox0)
  (local [(define (skip1 lox pos acc)
            (cond [(empty? lox) (reverse acc)]
                  [else
                   (if (odd? pos)
                       (skip1 (rest lox)
                              (add1 pos)
                              (cons (first lox) acc))
                       (skip1 (rest lox)
                              (add1 pos)
                              acc))]))]

    (skip1 lox0 1 empty)))
SOLUTION ANSWER
(define (skip1 lox0)
  (local [(define (skip1 lox acc)
            (cond [(empty? lox) empty]
                  [else
                   (if (odd? acc)
                       (cons (first lox)
                             (skip1 (rest lox)
                                    (add1 acc)))
                       (skip1 (rest lox)
                              (add1 acc)))]))]
    
    (skip1 lox0 1)))
